intro: Jamesbrittenia canescens var. canescens, commonly known as the silverleaf jamesbrittenia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its compact growth habit makes it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and drought tolerance.
